skill.name: brainstorming
skill.description: You MUST use this before any creative work - creating features, building components, adding functionality, or modifying behavior. Explores user intent, requirements and design before implementation.
skill.summary: You MUST use this before any creative work - creating features, building components, adding function...
skill.author: obra

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidance text. No executable code, network operations, filesystem access, or command execution is present in the skill file itself. The skill guides AI behavior through natural language instructions.

content.user_title: Explore ideas through collaborative design dialogue
content.value_statement: Many AI projects fail because implementation begins before requirements are clear. This skill guides structured exploration of user intent, constraints, and design alternatives through natural conversation. It produces validated designs before any code is written.
actual_capabilities: Asks clarifying questions one at a time to understand project goals
Proposes 2-3 design approaches with trade-offs and recommendations
Presents designs in small sections for incremental validation
Guides writing validated designs to documentation files
Creates implementation plans using git worktrees
limitations: Does not execute code or access external systems directly
Cannot access user project files without explicit AI action
Relies on AI to follow the structured process outlined
Does not generate actual code or implementation files

use_cases.title: Define feature requirements
use_cases.description: Collaborate with product managers to clarify feature goals before development begins

use_cases.title: Explore design alternatives
use_cases.description: Evaluate different architectural approaches with clear trade-off analysis

use_cases.title: Document technical designs
use_cases.description: Create validated design documents before starting implementation work

prompt_templates.title: Quick feature idea
prompt_templates.scenario: When user has a basic idea
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to add a feature that allows users to export their data to CSV format. Help me explore this idea through your brainstorming process.

prompt_templates.title: System design
prompt_templates.prompt: We need to build a notification service that handles email, SMS, and push notifications. Guide me through designing this system step by step.

prompt_templates.title: Refine existing plan
prompt_templates.prompt: We have an existing user authentication system using passwords. I want to add two-factor authentication. Walk me through the design options.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Should we use a microservices architecture or a monolith for our new e-commerce platform? Help me explore both options thoroughly.

output_examples.input: I want to build a feature that lets users share their dashboards with others
output: Before we design this, I have some questions:
1. What type of sharing do you need?
2. Should shared dashboards be public (anyone with link) or private (only invited users)?
3. Do you need to set expiration dates for shared access?
Please answer one at a time and I'll refine my understanding...

best_practices: Start by reviewing existing project context before beginning design exploration
Ask only one question per message to keep responses focused
Always present multiple approaches with clear trade-offs before recommending one
Validate design sections incrementally before moving to the next section
anti_patterns: Starting implementation before design is validated by stakeholders
Asking multiple questions in a single response
Skipping trade-off analysis for different approaches
Failing to document the design before beginning work

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is most effective with Claude and Claude Code.

faq.question: How long does the design process take?
faq.answer: Design complexity varies. Simple features may take 3-5 exchanges. Complex systems may require 15-20 exchanges.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill starts by reviewing project context, files, and recent commits before asking questions.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance. It does not read or write files without explicit AI action.

faq.question: How is this different from regular prompting?
faq.answer: This skill enforces a structured process with one question at a time and incremental design validation.

faq.question: What skills work well with this?
faq.answer: Use with writing-plans for implementation details and using-git-worktrees for isolated workspaces.
